posts.name: Tio
Nolan Barker
posts.cooked:
Tio:

k2024Crescendo

This doesn’t seem right… Aren’t we in 2025?

posts.name: Nolan Barker
posts.cooked: Also, I’m not seeing a constructor in the docs for a PhotonPoseEstimator that takes a camera ( source ). Are you certain that you’re running the latest version of PV ?

posts.name: Nolan Barker
posts.cooked: One more thing: If you’re not getting 3D estimates, make sure that 3D processing is enabled in the PV UI. With this still set to 2D, you’d see tags, but never get pose estimates.

Make sure your camera is calibrated and set to 3D modes

Make sure you aren’t in one of the local Rio detection models like trig that requires you to add the robot heading before you get the pose

Use the photonvision discord. Those guys JUMP on questions there

posts.name: Paul Rensing
posts.cooked: Start at the PV web interface, and maybe post a screenshot. As was asked, is PV actually running in 3D mode? You should be seeing a 3D box on each found tag, and it should be reporting x,y,z poses in the GUI.

posts.name: Isaac
posts.cooked:
Have you tried opening advantage scope to see if photo vision is publishing stuff to network table?

Make sure the name of the camera matches in the code and the network table tab that photon vision is publishing to

posts.name: Paul Rensing
posts.cooked: Is PV set to do multi-tag? Given that the two tags are nowhere near located like on a real field, it might be producing crazy results which then get rejected. Have you tried just a single tag?

posts.name: Tio
Jason
posts.cooked: Do you have the photo vision discord link?

posts.name: Tio
posts.cooked: yes, got some good help there. I now need to work on drive code. Any advise on getting it to work with ctre electronics with swerve drive

posts.name: Jason
posts.cooked: Can you send the link to me, thank you
